com.apriori.collections

Interface MapBuilder<K,V,M extends Map<K,V>,B extends MapBuilder<K,V,M,B>>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of keys in the map
    V - the type of values in the map
    M - the type of map built
    B - the type of this builder

    public interface MapBuilder<K,V,M extends Map<K,V>,B extends MapBuilder<K,V,M,B>>
    An interface for imperatively constructing a map using a builder pattern and method chaining.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

      Builds the map.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        B put(K key,
      V value)
        Adds an item to the map being built.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the new entry
        value - the value of the new entry
        Returns:
        this builder (for method chaining)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a map has already been built but the builder has not yet been reset

      • putAll

        B putAll(Map<? extends K,? extends V> otherMap)
        Adds all items from another map into the map being built.
        Parameters:
        otherMap - the entries to add to the map
        Returns:
        this builder (for method chaining)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a map has already been built but the builder has not yet been reset

      • build

        M build()
        Builds the map. This builder is not usable again after the map is built until reset() is invoked.
        Returns:
        the map

      • buildAndContinue

        default M buildAndContinue()
        Builds the map, but keeps this builder usable for adding other elements in addition to the already added elements.

        Implementations will need to copy the elements added so far into a new map. The extra copy can usually be avoided, as long as the builder is no longer needed, by instead using build().

        The default implementation looks like so:

         M builtMap = build();
 reset();          // make builder usable again
 putAll(builtMap); // seed it with elements already added
 return builtMap;
        Returns:
        the map

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the map so it can be re-used to construct another map. Items previously added to the map builder are cleared. This method must be called after build() to make more than one map from the same builder.

      • forUnmodifiableMap

        static <K,V> MapBuilder<K,V,?,?> forUnmodifiableMap()
        Returns a map builder that constructs unmodifiable maps. Iteration order of the returned map is deterministic and is the same order as elements are added to the builder.
        Returns:
        a map builder that builds unmodifiable maps

      • forUnmodifiableMap

        static <K,V> MapBuilder<K,V,?,?> forUnmodifiableMap(MapBuilder<K,V,?,?> base)
        Returns a map builder that constructs unmodifiable maps. The underlying map is built using the given builder and then wrapped via Collections.unmodifiableMap(Map).
        Returns:
        a map builder that builds unmodifiable maps

      • forHashMap

        static <K,V> MapBuilder<K,V,HashMap<K,V>,?> forHashMap()
        Returns a map builder that constructs HashMap instances.
        Returns:
        a map builder that constructs HashMap instances

      • forLinkedHashMap

        static <K,V> MapBuilder<K,V,LinkedHashMap<K,V>,?> forLinkedHashMap()
        Returns a map builder that constructs LinkedHashMap instances. Iteration order of the built map is the same as the order that elements are added to the builder.
        Returns:
        a map builder that constructs LinkedHashMap instances

      • forTreeMap

        static <K extends Comparable<K>,V> MapBuilder<K,V,TreeMap<K,V>,?> forTreeMap()
        Returns a map builder that constructs TreeMap instances.
        Returns:
        a map builder that constructs TreeMap instances

      • forTreeMap

        static <K,V> MapBuilder<K,V,TreeMap<K,V>,?> forTreeMap(Comparator<? super K> comparator)
        Returns a map builder that constructs TreeMap instances that orders elements per the given comparator.
        Returns:
        a map builder that constructs TreeMap instances

        static <K,V> MapBuilder<K,V,HamtMap<K,V>,?> forHamtMap()
        Returns a map builder that constructs HamtMap instances.
        Returns:
        a map builder that constructs HamtMap instances

        static <K extends Comparable<K>,V> MapBuilder<K,V,ConcurrentSkipListMap<K,V>,?> forConcurrentSkipListMap()

        static <K,V> MapBuilder<K,V,ConcurrentSkipListMap<K,V>,?> forConcurrentSkipListMap(Comparator<? super K> comparator)

        Returns:

      • withMapConstructor

        static <K,V,M extends Map<K,V>> MapBuilder<K,V,M,?> withMapConstructor(Supplier<M> mapConstructor)
        Returns a map builder that constructs maps using the given map constructor. The returned map builder will throw IllegalStateException during a reset if the given supplier returns a non-empty map.
        Parameters:
        mapConstructor - a supplier of a new, empty map
        Returns:
        a map builder that constructs maps using the given supplier
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the given supplier returns a non-empty map the first time it is called (when initializing the returned builder)
